ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse
Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse

Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse is great. Honest and candid and super helpful in clearly laying out the pros and cons of our research design and writing styles. she is the greatest asset to the course.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse gives very helpful comments on presentations and written work. She is thoughtful and really understands how we as students can improve our experimental design, presentation formatting, and writing. She is a really amazing teacher, I have only good things to say about her.
Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse cares a ton, and is an excellent mentor. It's been a pleasure to have her thoughts and suggestions on the development of my research.

Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  She is always willing to give feedback, and makes herself available to students needs. offers valuable opinions and personal anecdotes, and remembers what its like to be a beginner at research. She puts in 100%.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I wish there had been more focus on the first years. It would have been nice to present our background research, and talk about our plans for the summer (aside from the last week or two where we did so). It just got very repetitive and frankly boring to sit and listen to the same presentations over and over again, and then listed to 30 minutes of feedback that was super specific to that one presentation and usually not something I could apply to my future presentations. I did like having other people (like the presenting coach) come in ate mix things up. More of that might be helpful, or potentially bringing in other second years from other labs to hear about what they are doing.
The course is a great time to learn from others in the process of producing research. Glad to have a lab like this to generate valuable feedback from peers and advisors.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: It's really helpful to spend time doing research in this class

I think the most useful aspects from my own personal development were the focus on presentations. I felt that the frequent presenting format was helpful in fine-tuning my own presentation, as well as becoming more comfortable with speaking in front of people and coming to learn my own presentation style.
presentation feedback.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think better involvement of the first years would help keep them more engaged, and could potentially help prepare them more for the second year.

The course focuses heavily on the 2nd years. It would have been great to have some deliverables for the first years, and more opportunities for us to share our progress. and especially to report on our methodology, earlier on in the semester.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Informal, casual, comfortable environment to give feedback and ask questions. But, definitely heavily focused on 2nd years.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Essential class for environmental and forest science research students
Key for a MESc student. Excellent for practicing oral presentations
This is a weekly lab meeting, designed for MFS students to report on the progress of our research and fine tune it. It is an essential course for me, and I am grateful that it's offered for us.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Required research course, but I would take it anyway even if it weren't required

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes

yes and no. I learned a lot about the process I will be going through next year, but there was little focus on the processes being experienced by first years, as far as concerns we should have about field conditions, common methodology concerns or how to secure our summer funding.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Invest in working on your presentation skills
first years should ask to be better integrated into the course, to get the most out of it.
